title: High-aspect 3D two-photon polymerization structuring with widened objective working range (WOW-2PP)
title_cn: 具有宽目标工作范围的高纵横3D双光子聚合结构（WOW-2PP）
abstract: We developed a novel two-photon polymerization (2PP) configuration for fabrication of high-aspect three-dimensional (3D) structures, with an overall height larger than working distance of the microscope objective used for laser beam focusing into a photosensitive material. This method is based on a modified optical 2PP setup, where a microscope objective (100× high N.A.), immersion oil and cover glass can be moved together into the photosensitive material, resulting in an effective higher and wider objective working range (WOW-2PP). The proposed technique enables the fabrication of high-aspect structures with sub-micrometer process resolution. 3D structures with a height of 7 mm are demonstrated, which could hardly be built with the conventional 2PP set-up due to refractive index mismatch and laser beam disturbances.
abstract_cn: 我们开发了一种新颖的两光子聚合（2PP）配置，用于制造高纵横比（3D）结构，其总高度大于用于将激光束聚焦到光敏材料中的显微镜物镜的工作距离。 。 此方法基于改进的光学2PP设置，其中显微镜物镜（100＆＃215;高NA），浸没油和盖玻片可一起移动到光敏材料中，从而有效地提高了物镜的工作范围并扩大了工作范围（WOW -2PP）。 所提出的技术使得能够以亚微米工艺分辨率制造高纵横比的结构。 演示了高度为7毫米的3D结构，由于折射率不匹配和激光束干扰，很难用常规的2PP设置来构建。

title: Direct imaging of the near field and dynamics of surface plasmon resonance on gold nanostructures using photoemission electron microscopy
title_cn: 使用光发射电子显微镜直接成像金纳米结构上的近场和表面等离子体共振的动力学
abstract: Localized surface plasmon resonance (LSPR) can be supported by metallic nanoparticles and engineered nanostructures. An understanding of the spatially resolved near-field properties and dynamics of LSPR is important, but remains experimentally challenging. We report experimental studies toward this aim using photoemission electron microscopy (PEEM) with high spatial resolution of sub-10 nm. Various engineered gold nanostructure arrays (such as rods, nanodisk-like particles and dimers) are investigated via PEEM using near-infrared (NIR) femtosecond laser pulses as the excitation source. When the LSPR wavelengths overlap the spectrum of the femtosecond pulses, the LSPR is efficiently excited and promotes multiphoton photoemission, which is correlated with the local intensity of the metallic nanoparticles in the near field. Thus, the local field distribution of the LSPR on different Au nanostructures can be directly explored and discussed using the PEEM images. In addition, the dynamics of the LSPR is studied by combining interferometric time-resolved pump-probe technique and PEEM. Detailed information on the oscillation and dephasing of the LSPR field can be obtained. The results identify PEEM as a powerful tool for accessing the near-field mapping and dynamic properties of plasmonic nanostructures.
abstract_cn: 局部表面等离子体激元共振（LSPR）可以由金属纳米颗粒和工程纳米结构支持。了解空间分辨的近场特性和LSPR的动力学很重要，但在实验上仍然具有挑战性。我们报道了使用具有低于10nm的高空间分辨率的光发射电子显微镜（PEEM）朝着这一目标的实验研究。通过PEEM使用近红外（NIR）飞秒激光脉冲作为激发源，通过PEEM研究了各种工程化的金纳米结构阵列（例如，棒，纳米盘状颗粒和二聚体）。当LSPR波长与飞秒脉冲的光谱重叠时，LSPR被有效激发并促进多光子光发射，这与金属纳米粒子在近场中的局部强度相关。因此，可以使用PEEM图像直接探索和讨论LSPR在不同金纳米结构上的局部场分布。此外，结合干涉时间分辨泵浦探测技术和PEEM研究了LSPR的动力学。可以获得有关LSPR字段的振荡和移相的详细信息。结果表明，PEEM是访问等离激元纳米结构的近场映射和动态特性的强大工具。</ p>
